Enterprise Serial Bus 1.1 Usable User is now available in the Alpha version.

Apr 3, 2018

Enterprie Serial Bus 1.1 Usable User is now available in the Alpha version.

Theoretically, we have to write tests for selected controllers, but you can already use Api version 1.1 Alpha. Api is based on the basic assumptions of reactive programming, such as the use of actors from the Akka package. We invite you to test and submit comments and transfer donations. If the subsidies exceed 5,000 usd, we will go fully on Fast Data.

Usage

git clone https://github.com/silenceonthewire/com.silenceonthewire.esb.git</p>

cd com.silenceonthewire.esb</p>

sbt run</p>

How to use this version?

Companies actions

While working on our api, we assumed that to create a user, you have to create at least one company. Therefore, as the first element we explain activities on companies.

Add new company

There is a newCompany.json file in the com.silenceonthewire.esb/test-data/company directory. This file is sent to the server by the command:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d @newCompany.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/add</p>

And we get the answer:

{"id": 1522759308539, "createdAt": 1522759308539, "updatedAt": 1522759308539, "name": "Example Company", "phone": "123456789", "taxNumber": "1234567890", "email": "company @ example.com "," address ":" street 1 "," city ":" city "," state ":" state "," country ":" country "," postalCode ":" 11-111 "," users "[]}</p>

Update company

There is a currentCompany.json file in the com.silenceonthewire.esb/test-data/company directory. This file is sent to the server by the command:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X PUT -d @currentCompany.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/update</p>

And we get the answer:

{"id":1522759308539,"createdAt":1522759308539,"updatedAt":1522760348933,"name":"Example Company","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Delete company

To delete company we send the following request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X DELETE http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/delete/1522759308539</p>

If the removal succeeds, the system will return the data of the deleted company:

{"id":1522759308539,"createdAt":1522759308539,"updatedAt":1522760348933,"name":"Example Company","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Get company by id

To get the company by the id number, send the following request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/getById/1522760698755</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522760698755,"createdAt":1522760698756,"updatedAt":1522760698756,"name":"Example Company","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Get company by name

To get the company by the name, send the following request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/getByName/ExampleCompany</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

.bundle .sass-cache Gemfile.lock *.gem

{"id":1522760698755,"createdAt":1522760698756,"updatedAt":1522760698756,"name":"Example Company","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Get company by tax number

To get company by the tax numner, send the following request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/getByTaxNumber/1234567890</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522760698755,"createdAt":1522760698756,"updatedAt":1522760698756,"name":"Example Company","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Get company by email

To get company by the email, send the following request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/getByEmail/company@example.com</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522760698755,"createdAt":1522760698756,"updatedAt":1522760698756,"name":"Example Company","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Get company by phone

To get company by the phone, send the following request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/getByPhone/123456789</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522761344385,"createdAt":1522761344385,"updatedAt":1522761344385,"name":"ExampleCompany","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}</p>

Get all companies

To get all companies, send the following request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/company/all</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

[{"id":1522761344385,"createdAt":1522761344385,"updatedAt":1522761344385,"name":"ExampleCompany","phone":"123456789","taxNumber":"1234567890","email":"company@example.com","address":"street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"11-111","users":[]}]</p>

Users actions

User management is the second part of the api. It allows you to quickly create, edit, find and delete users.

Create new user

If you can add user, send the following request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d @newUser.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/add</p>

if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522772875674,"createdAt":1522772875674,"updatedAt":1522772875674,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john1@doe.com","phone":"12345167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true},{"id":1522772977796,"createdAt":1522772977796,"updatedAt":1522772977796,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john@doe.com","phone":"1235167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Update user

If you can update user, send the following request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X PUT -d @currentUser.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/edit/1522772875674</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522772875674,"createdAt":1522772875674,"updatedAt":1522773478050,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john322343@doe.com","phone":"12334325167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Get user by id

If you can get user by id, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/getById/1522772875674</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522772875674,"createdAt":1522772875674,"updatedAt":1522773478050,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john322343@doe.com","phone":"12334325167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Get user by phone

If you can get user by id, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/getByPhone/12334325167689</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522772875674,"createdAt":1522772875674,"updatedAt":1522773478050,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john322343@doe.com","phone":"12334325167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Get user by email

If you can get user by id, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/getByEmail/john322343@doe.com</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522772875674,"createdAt":1522772875674,"updatedAt":1522773478050,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john322343@doe.com","phone":"12334325167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Get all users

If you can get all users, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/all</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

[{"id":1522772875674,"createdAt":1522772875674,"updatedAt":1522773478050,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john322343@doe.com","phone":"12334325167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true},{"id":1522772977796,"createdAt":1522772977796,"updatedAt":1522772977796,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john@doe.com","phone":"1235167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}]</p>

Get user by phone and password

If you can get user by phone and password, you must send this request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d @phoneAndPassword.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/getByPhoneAndPassword</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522776276728,"createdAt":1522776276728,"updatedAt":1522776276728,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john@doe.com","phone":"1235167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Get user by email and password

If you can get user by email and password, you must send this request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d @emailAndPassword.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/getByEmailAndPassword</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522776276728,"createdAt":1522776276728,"updatedAt":1522776276728,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john@doe.com","phone":"1235167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Delete user

If you can get delete user, you must send this request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X DELETE http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/user/delete/1522776276728</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522776276728,"createdAt":1522776276728,"updatedAt":1522776276728,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john@doe.com","phone":"1235167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true}</p>

Account actions

User accounts are the last element. It contains some very simple operations. I already explain.

Create account

If you can get create account, you must send this request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d @newAccount.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/account/create</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522783057798,"createdAt":1522783057798,"updatedAt":1522783057798,"user":null,"taxNumber":"21434","ssn":"43546547","address":"Street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"23334"}</p>

Get by id

If you can get account by id, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/account/id/1522783057798</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522783057798,"createdAt":1522783057798,"updatedAt":1522783057798,"user":null,"taxNumber":"21434","ssn":"43546547","address":"Street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"23334"}</p>

Get by tax number

If you can get account by id, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/account/taxNumber/21434</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522783057798,"createdAt":1522783057798,"updatedAt":1522783057798,"user":null,"taxNumber":"21434","ssn":"43546547","address":"Street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"23334"}</p>

Get by ssn

If you can get account by ssn, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/account/bySsn/43546547</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522783057798,"createdAt":1522783057798,"updatedAt":1522783057798,"user":null,"taxNumber":"21434","ssn":"43546547","address":"Street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"23334"}</p>

Get by user

If you can get account by user, you must send this request:

curl http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/account/byUser/1522831550466</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522783057798,"createdAt":1522783057798,"updatedAt":1522783057798,"user":null,"taxNumber":"21434","ssn":"43546547","address":"Street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"23334"}</p>

Update account

If you can update account, you must send this request:

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X PUT -d @currentAccount.json http://localhost:9000/api/v1/users/account/update</p>

And if the request succeeds, the system will be returned:

{"id":1522783057798,"createdAt":1522783057798,"updatedAt":1522786151443,"user":{"id":1522782031521,"createdAt":1522782031521,"updatedAt":1522782031521,"firstName":"jonh","lastName":"Doe","email":"john@doe.com","phone":"1235167689","isAdmin":true,"admin":true},"taxNumber":"df21434","ssn":"435465rte47","address":"Street 1","city":"city","state":"state","country":"country","postalCode":"23334"}</p>

What's next?

As I have already mentioned, we will reach the full Fast Data if the amount of your shares exceeds 5,000 usd. Then we'll break into Apache Kafka and Cassandra's base.

Additionally, remember that you can already post orders related to FastData, I am more interested in freelancing than full-time job. Calculations using artificial intelligence? There is no welding. Rewriting the existing application interface to something deadly fast is also not a problem.

What's next with this project? First of all, I want to stabilize all available api this week. And then I want to write files management with the OCR system, so I can not do without Tesserac and Elastic Search. Greetings and look forward to the news.

About

We are a team of people who work on this project and it is usually a full-time job. That is why we ask for your support. Any amount that will help in the development of this project is really welcome.
